title: Energy
data:
Your **power**, or "**Pw**", is the amount of magical **energy** you have. For example:

```
Dlvl:3  $:43  HP:68(68) Pw:13(18) AC:-3  Xp:8/1295 T:2358
```

The above [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows a character whose current power is 13 and maximum power is 18.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Uses of energy](#Uses_of_energy)

- [2 Gaining energy](#Gaining_energy)

  - [2.1 Specific methods](#Specific_methods)
  - [2.2 Energy regeneration](#Energy_regeneration)
  - [2.3 Level gain and starting energy](#Level_gain_and_starting_energy)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [4 References](#References)

- [5 External links](#External_links)

## Uses of energy

The main use of energy is to [cast spells](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting"). You need 5 times the spell's level of energy to cast a spell. When carrying the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), there is an additional random cost. This cost applies *only* to spellcasting, not to any other expenditure of energy. See [spellcasting cost](/wiki/Spellcasting#Spellcasting_cost "Spellcasting") for more details.

[Teleportation at will](/wiki/Teleport_at_will "Teleport at will") from [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis") requires 20 energy, but only consumes 19.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) The usual random teleportation from teleportitis does not use energy.

Certain `#monster` commands require energy. The [breath weapons](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon") of [dragons](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon"), [iron golems](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem"), [winter wolves](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf") and [hell hounds](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound") all cost 15 energy.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Summoning help as a [werecreature](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature")[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) and emitting psychic blasts as a [mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer")[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) both cost 10 energy.

## Gaining energy

You normally regain energy slowly over time, unless your [encumbrance](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance") is `Stressed` or worse, which blocks normal energy regeneration. Having [the Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica") allows you to regain energy rapidly, even when stressed.

### Specific methods

Quaffing a non-cursed [potion of gain energy](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_energy "Potion of gain energy") increases your current and maximum energy; a cursed potion decreases them.

`#invoke` [the Mitre of Holiness](/wiki/The_Mitre_of_Holiness "The Mitre of Holiness") to regain half the energy you need to reach the maximum, but no more than 120 points.

Reading any [scroll of charging](/wiki/Scroll_of_charging "Scroll of charging") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") recharges your energy to its maximum. If it was already maximum, you gain 5d4 total energy instead.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) In 3.6.0 or later cursed scroll will reduce energy to 0 without altering the maximum “*You feel discharged.*”

Eating a [newt](/wiki/Newt "Newt") corpse sometimes increases energy by 1 to 3 points. If this would put you over the maximum, your maximum energy might also increase by 1.

If you trigger a [magic trap](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap") and it explodes, “*Your body absorbs some of the magical energy!*” and your maximum energy is increased by 2; your energy is then completely refilled.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

Attacking a [spellcasting monster](/wiki/Monster_spell#Spells "Monster spell") with [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane") has a chance of [cancelling](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation") it and increasing your current and maximum energy by 1 (“*You absorb magical energy!*”)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7). Only the cancellation from Magicbane can absorb energy. This effect happens every time the cancellation attack hits, not just the first time, when the monster is actually cancelled.

Lying with a [foocubus](/wiki/Foocubus "Foocubus") may increase or decrease your energy.

In older versions of NetHack, the [polyself bug](/wiki/Polyself_bug "Polyself bug") could be exploited to increase your maximum energy exponentially. However, this bug was fixed in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") and thus is no longer usable.

### Energy regeneration

The rate at which energy regenerates over time increases with your [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"), [wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom"), and [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence"). If your [encumbrance](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance") level is `Stressed` or higher it will not regenerate.

Your energy normally regenerates every ![\lfloor (38 - \mathit{level}) \times 3 / 6 \rfloor](/images/math/0/9/2/0920a786407c3611d35f3640c9d9e937.png) turns if you are a [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), and every ![\lfloor (38 - \mathit{level}) \times 4 / 6 \rfloor](/images/math/6/1/7/61714375fc9715fed8926396a57f7a30.png) turns for other roles.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) If you carry [the Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica"), you regenerate energy every turn regardless of role.

The amount of energy regenerated each time is between 1 and ![\lfloor (\mathit{Wis} + \mathit{Int}) / 15 \rfloor + 1](/images/math/6/b/b/6bbe796b3f211844ebb5df610b6d63f3.png), which for most characters means *1d2* or *1d3*. Increasing that to *1d4* requires a well-enchanted [helm of brilliance](/wiki/Helm_of_brilliance "Helm of brilliance") since no playable race has Wisdom and Intelligence caps high enough to reach a total of 45.

Number of turns between regenerating energy:

| Level | Non-wizard | Wizard |
| ----- | ---------- | ------ |
| 1     | 24         | 18     |
| 2     | 24         | 18     |
| 3     | 23         | 17     |
| 4     | 22         | 17     |
| 5     | 22         | 16     |
| 6     | 21         | 16     |
| 7     | 20         | 15     |
| 8     | 20         | 15     |
| 9     | 19         | 14     |
| 10    | 18         | 14     |
| 11    | 18         | 13     |
| 12    | 17         | 13     |
| 13    | 16         | 12     |
| 14    | 16         | 12     |
| 15    | 15         | 11     |
| 16    | 14         | 11     |
| 17    | 14         | 10     |
| 18    | 13         | 10     |
| 19    | 12         | 9      |
| 20    | 12         | 9      |
| 21    | 11         | 8      |
| 22    | 10         | 8      |
| 23    | 10         | 7      |
| 24    | 9          | 7      |
| 25    | 8          | 6      |
| 26    | 8          | 6      |
| 27    | 7          | 5      |
| 28    | 6          | 5      |
| 29    | 6          | 4      |
| 30    | 5          | 4      |

### Level gain and starting energy

When you gain a level, both your current and maximum energy are increased based on various factors:[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

- your [role](/wiki/Role "Role")
- your [race](/wiki/Race "Race")
- your [Wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom")
- your [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level")

First, a random number ![0 \leq n < \left( \frac{\text{Wisdom}}{2} + \text{role modifier}\right)](/images/math/c/8/7/c87d99efacc84c5f70ca4354b1b8db41.png) is chosen;[\[10\]](#cite_note-10) your race minimum is then added to the result.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)

Your role modifier depends on whether your experience level (before the level gain) is lower than a certain cutoff which varies between roles. If it is, apply the "low-[XL](/wiki/XL "XL")" modifier; else use the "high-XL" modifier.

The result of this is then multiplied with your energy modifier, which depends on your role, and rounded down.[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

The final result will be added to both your current and maximum energy.

For a newly created character neither energy modifier nor Wisdom matters[\[13\]](#cite_note-13): certain magically inclined roles start with a few energy points at random, while others only get one point; all races except Dwarves also get a bonus point or two. See the table below for precise numbers.

| Role                                     | Cutoff | low-[XL](/wiki/XL "XL") modifier | high-XL modifier | energy modifier[\[14\]](#cite_note-14) | starting |
| ---------------------------------------- | ------ | -------------------------------- | ---------------- | -------------------------------------- | -------- |
| [Arc](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") | 14     | 1                                | 1                | 1                                      | 1        |
| [Bar](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian")       | 10     | 1                                | 1                | 3/4                                    | 1        |
| [Cav](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman")           | 10     | 1                                | 1                | 1                                      | 1        |
| [Hea](/wiki/Healer "Healer")             | 20     | 1                                | 2                | 3/2                                    | 2-5      |
| [Kni](/wiki/Knight "Knight")             | 10     | 1                                | 2                | 3/2                                    | 2-5      |
| [Mon](/wiki/Monk "Monk")                 | 10     | 2                                | 2                | 1                                      | 3-4      |
| [Pri](/wiki/Priest "Priest")             | 10     | 2                                | 2                | 2                                      | 5-7      |
| [Rog](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue")               | 11     | 1                                | 1                | 1                                      | 1        |
| [Ran](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger")             | 12     | 1                                | 1                | 1                                      | 1        |
| [Sam](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai")           | 11     | 1                                | 1                | 1                                      | 1        |
| [Tou](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")           | 14     | 1                                | 1                | 1                                      | 1        |
| [Val](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")         | 10     | 1                                | 1                | 3/4                                    | 1        |
| [Wiz](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard")             | 12     | 2                                | 3                | 2                                      | 5-7      |

| Race                                                           | minimum gain | starting |
| -------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | -------- |
| [Human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") | 2            | +1       |
| [Elf](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)")       | 3            | +2       |
| [Dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") | 0            | no bonus |
| [Gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") | 2            | +2       |
| [Orc](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)")       | 1            | +1       |

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

Self-teleport costs 30 points of power.[\[15\]](#cite_note-15)

The energy regeration frequency formula is changed to ![\lfloor (45 - \mathit{level}) \times 3 / 6 \rfloor](/images/math/a/2/9/a29ad1211a1f38f1aaa16941ab9ab271.png) turns if you are a [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), and every ![\lfloor (45 - \mathit{level}) \times 4 / 6 \rfloor](/images/math/3/b/2/3b2b23963b21db5eff9edb6eb1ee1d59.png) for all other roles.

### FIQHack

There are numerous changes to energy and energy regeneration in [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack").

- Monsters and players use the same spellcasting system, which means that monsters use energy to cast spells instead of using a cooldown system. This means they can potentially cast multiple spells in succession if they have enough energy, so high-level spellcasting monsters can do much more damage.

* Wisdom is slightly less important for energy regeneration and experience level is slightly more important. Intelligence is not considered.

- Wizards get a boost of +0.33pw/turn for energy regeneration

* [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica") confers +1pw/turn for energy regeneration

- Players can be [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled"), which results in 0 available energy until cured.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [teleport.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 517](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/teleport.c#line517 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/teleport.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [polyself.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 748](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/polyself.c#line748 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/polyself.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [polyself.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 910](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/polyself.c#line910 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/polyself.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [polyself.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1075](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/polyself.c#line1075 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/polyself.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [read.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1056](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/read.c#line1056 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/read.c")
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [trap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1058](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/trap.c#line1058 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/trap.c")
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [artifact.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 844](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/artifact.c#line844 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/artifact.c")
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [allmain.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 211](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/allmain.c#line211 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/allmain.c")
9. [↑](#cite_ref-9) [exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 195](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/exper.c#line195 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/exper.c")
10. [↑](#cite_ref-10) [exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 196](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/exper.c#line196 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/exper.c"): *The function also considers a race modifier, but this is 0 for all races.*
11. [↑](#cite_ref-11) [exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 197](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/exper.c#line197 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/exper.c"): *This also considers a role minimum, but this is 0 for all roles.*
12. [↑](#cite_ref-12) [exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 201](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/exper.c#line201 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/exper.c")
13. [↑](#cite_ref-13) [newpw](/wiki/Source:Exper.c#newpw "Source:Exper.c") in [exper.c](/wiki/Source:Exper.c "Source:Exper.c")
14. [↑](#cite_ref-14) [enermod](/wiki/Source:Exper.c#enermod "Source:Exper.c") in [exper.c](/wiki/Source:Exper.c "Source:Exper.c")
15. [↑](#cite_ref-15) [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/teleport.c, line 790](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/teleport.c#line790 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/teleport.c")

## External links

- [HP and power starting values, level increases, and regeneration in NetHack 3.4.3](http://www.steelypips.org/nethack/343/hppw-343.txt)

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

html:
Energy

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Your power, or "Pw", is the amount of magical energy you have. For example: 

Dlvl:3  $:43  HP:68(68) Pw:13(18) AC:-3  Xp:8/1295 T:2358

The above status line shows a character whose current power is 13 and maximum power is 18.

Contents

  • 1 Uses of energy
  • 2 Gaining energy
    • 2.1 Specific methods
    • 2.2 Energy regeneration
    • 2.3 Level gain and starting energy
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 FIQHack
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

Uses of energy

The main use of energy is to cast spells. You need 5 times the spell's level of energy to cast a spell. When carrying the Amulet of Yendor, there is an additional random cost. This cost applies only to spellcasting, not to any other expenditure of energy. See spellcasting cost for more details.

Teleportation at will from teleportitis requires 20 energy, but only consumes 19.[1] The usual random teleportation from teleportitis does not use energy.

Certain #monster commands require energy. The breath weapons of dragons, iron golems, winter wolves and hell hounds all cost 15 energy.[2] Summoning help as a werecreature[3] and emitting psychic blasts as a mind flayer[4] both cost 10 energy.

Gaining energy

You normally regain energy slowly over time, unless your encumbrance is Stressed or worse, which blocks normal energy regeneration. Having the Eye of the Aethiopica allows you to regain energy rapidly, even when stressed.

Specific methods

Quaffing a non-cursed potion of gain energy increases your current and maximum energy; a cursed potion decreases them.

#invoke the Mitre of Holiness to regain half the energy you need to reach the maximum, but no more than 120 points.

Reading any scroll of charging while confused recharges your energy to its maximum. If it was already maximum, you gain 5d4 total energy instead.[5] In 3.6.0 or later cursed scroll will reduce energy to 0 without altering the maximum “You feel discharged.”

Eating a newt corpse sometimes increases energy by 1 to 3 points. If this would put you over the maximum, your maximum energy might also increase by 1.

If you trigger a magic trap and it explodes, “Your body absorbs some of the magical energy!” and your maximum energy is increased by 2; your energy is then completely refilled.[6]

Attacking a spellcasting monster with Magicbane has a chance of cancelling it and increasing your current and maximum energy by 1 (“You absorb magical energy!”)[7]. Only the cancellation from Magicbane can absorb energy. This effect happens every time the cancellation attack hits, not just the first time, when the monster is actually cancelled.

Lying with a foocubus may increase or decrease your energy.

In older versions of NetHack, the polyself bug could be exploited to increase your maximum energy exponentially. However, this bug was fixed in NetHack 3.6.0 and thus is no longer usable.

Energy regeneration

The rate at which energy regenerates over time increases with your experience level, wisdom, and intelligence. If your encumbrance level is Stressed or higher it will not regenerate.

Your energy normally regenerates every turns if you are a Wizard, and every turns for other roles.[8] If you carry the Eye of the Aethiopica, you regenerate energy every turn regardless of role.

The amount of energy regenerated each time is between 1 and , which for most characters means 1d2 or 1d3. Increasing that to 1d4 requires a well-enchanted helm of brilliance since no playable race has Wisdom and Intelligence caps high enough to reach a total of 45.

Number of turns between regenerating energy:

Level Non-wizard Wizard
1 24 18
2 24 18
3 23 17
4 22 17
5 22 16
6 21 16
7 20 15
8 20 15
9 19 14
10 18 14
11 18 13
12 17 13
13 16 12
14 16 12
15 15 11
16 14 11
17 14 10
18 13 10
19 12 9
20 12 9
21 11 8
22 10 8
23 10 7
24 9 7
25 8 6
26 8 6
27 7 5
28 6 5
29 6 4
30 5 4

Level gain and starting energy

When you gain a level, both your current and maximum energy are increased based on various factors:[9]

  • your role
  • your race
  • your Wisdom
  • your experience level

First, a random number is chosen;[10] your race minimum is then added to the result.[11]

Your role modifier depends on whether your experience level (before the level gain) is lower than a certain cutoff which varies between roles. If it is, apply the "low-XL" modifier; else use the "high-XL" modifier.

The result of this is then multiplied with your energy modifier, which depends on your role, and rounded down.[12]

The final result will be added to both your current and maximum energy.

For a newly created character neither energy modifier nor Wisdom matters[13]: certain magically inclined roles start with a few energy points at random, while others only get one point; all races except Dwarves also get a bonus point or two. See the table below for precise numbers.

Role Cutoff low-XL
modifier 		high-XL
modifier 		energy modifier[14] starting
Arc 14 1 1 1 1
Bar 10 1 1 3/4 1
Cav 10 1 1 1 1
Hea 20 1 2 3/2 2-5
Kni 10 1 2 3/2 2-5
Mon 10 2 2 1 3-4
Pri 10 2 2 2 5-7
Rog 11 1 1 1 1
Ran 12 1 1 1 1
Sam 11 1 1 1 1
Tou 14 1 1 1 1
Val 10 1 1 3/4 1
Wiz 12 2 3 2 5-7
Race minimum gain starting
Human 2 +1
Elf 3 +2
Dwarf 0 no bonus
Gnome 2 +2
Orc 1 +1

Variants

SLASH'EM

Self-teleport costs 30 points of power.[15]

The energy regeration frequency formula is changed to turns if you are a Wizard, and every for all other roles.

FIQHack

There are numerous changes to energy and energy regeneration in FIQHack.

  • Monsters and players use the same spellcasting system, which means that monsters use energy to cast spells instead of using a cooldown system. This means they can potentially cast multiple spells in succession if they have enough energy, so high-level spellcasting monsters can do much more damage.
  • Wisdom is slightly less important for energy regeneration and experience level is slightly more important. Intelligence is not considered.
  • Wizards get a boost of +0.33pw/turn for energy regeneration
  • The Eye of the Aethiopica confers +1pw/turn for energy regeneration
  • Players can be cancelled, which results in 0 available energy until cured.


References

  1. ↑ teleport.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 517
  2. ↑ polyself.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 748
  3. ↑ polyself.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 910
  4. ↑ polyself.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1075
  5. ↑ read.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1056
  6. ↑ trap.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1058
  7. ↑ artifact.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 844
  8. ↑ allmain.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 211
  9. ↑ exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 195
  10. ↑ exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 196: The function also considers a race modifier, but this is 0 for all races.
  11. ↑ exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 197: This also considers a role minimum, but this is 0 for all roles.
  12. ↑ exper.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 201
  13. ↑ newpw in exper.c
  14. ↑ enermod in exper.c
  15. ↑ SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/teleport.c, line 790

External links

  • HP and power starting values, level increases, and regeneration in NetHack 3.4.3

rawPage:
Your '''power''', or "'''Pw'''", is the amount of magical '''energy''' you have. For example: Dlvl:3 $:43 HP:68(68) '''Pw:13(18)''' AC:-3 Xp:8/1295 T:2358 The above [[status line]] shows a character whose current power is 13 and maximum power is 18. == Uses of energy == The main use of energy is to [[spellcasting|cast spells]]. You need 5 times the spell's level of energy to cast a spell. When carrying the [[Amulet of Yendor]], there is an additional random cost. This cost applies ''only'' to spellcasting, not to any other expenditure of energy. See [[spellcasting#Spellcasting cost|spellcasting cost]] for more details. [[Teleport at will|Teleportation at will]] from [[teleportitis]] requires 20 energy, but only consumes 19.{{refsrc|teleport.c|517}} The usual random teleportation from teleportitis does not use energy. Certain [[monster (command)|#monster]] commands require energy. The [[breath weapon]]s of [[dragon]]s, [[iron golem]]s, [[winter wolf|winter wolves]] and [[hell hound]]s all cost 15 energy.{{refsrc|polyself.c|748}} Summoning help as a [[werecreature]]{{refsrc|polyself.c|910}} and emitting psychic blasts as a [[mind flayer]]{{refsrc|polyself.c|1075}} both cost 10 energy. == Gaining energy == You normally regain energy slowly over time, unless your [[encumbrance]] is Stressed or worse, which blocks normal energy regeneration. Having [[the Eye of the Aethiopica]] allows you to regain energy rapidly, even when stressed. === Specific methods === Quaffing a non-cursed [[potion of gain energy]] increases your current and maximum energy; a cursed potion decreases them. [[invoke|#invoke]] [[the Mitre of Holiness]] to regain half the energy you need to reach the maximum, but no more than 120 points. Reading any [[scroll of charging]] while [[confused]] recharges your energy to its maximum. If it was already maximum, you gain 5d4 total energy instead.{{refsrc|read.c|1056}} In 3.6.0 or later cursed scroll will reduce energy to 0 without altering the maximum “''You feel discharged.''” Eating a [[newt]] corpse sometimes increases energy by 1 to 3 points. If this would put you over the maximum, your maximum energy might also increase by 1. If you trigger a [[magic trap]] and it explodes, “''Your body absorbs some of the magical energy!''” and your maximum energy is increased by 2; your energy is then completely refilled.{{refsrc|trap.c|1058}} Attacking a [[Monster spell#Spells|spellcasting monster]] with [[Magicbane]] has a chance of [[cancellation|cancelling]] it and increasing your current and maximum energy by 1 (“''You absorb magical energy!''”){{refsrc|artifact.c|844}}. Only the cancellation from Magicbane can absorb energy. This effect happens every time the cancellation attack hits, not just the first time, when the monster is actually cancelled. Lying with a [[foocubus]] may increase or decrease your energy. In older versions of NetHack, the [[polyself bug]] could be exploited to increase your maximum energy exponentially. However, this bug was fixed in [[NetHack 3.6.0]] and thus is no longer usable. === Energy regeneration === The rate at which energy regenerates over time increases with your [[experience level]], [[wisdom]], and [[intelligence]]. If your [[encumbrance]] level is [[Stressed]] or higher it will not regenerate. Your energy normally regenerates every \lfloor (38 - \mathit{level}) \times 3 / 6 \rfloor turns if you are a [[Wizard]], and every \lfloor (38 - \mathit{level}) \times 4 / 6 \rfloor turns for other roles.{{refsrc|allmain.c|211}} If you carry [[the Eye of the Aethiopica]], you regenerate energy every turn regardless of role. The amount of energy regenerated each time is between 1 and \lfloor (\mathit{Wis} + \mathit{Int}) / 15 \rfloor + 1, which for most characters means ''1d2'' or ''1d3''. Increasing that to ''1d4'' requires a well-enchanted [[helm of brilliance]] since no playable race has Wisdom and Intelligence caps high enough to reach a total of 45. Number of turns between regenerating energy: {| class="prettytable" ! Level ! Non-wizard ! Wizard |- |- | 1 || 24 || 18 |- | 2 || 24 || 18 |- | 3 || 23 || 17 |- | 4 || 22 || 17 |- | 5 || 22 || 16 |- | 6 || 21 || 16 |- | 7 || 20 || 15 |- | 8 || 20 || 15 |- | 9 || 19 || 14 |- | 10 || 18 || 14 |- | 11 || 18 || 13 |- | 12 || 17 || 13 |- | 13 || 16 || 12 |- | 14 || 16 || 12 |- | 15 || 15 || 11 |- | 16 || 14 || 11 |- | 17 || 14 || 10 |- | 18 || 13 || 10 |- | 19 || 12 || 9 |- | 20 || 12 || 9 |- | 21 || 11 || 8 |- | 22 || 10 || 8 |- | 23 || 10 || 7 |- | 24 || 9 || 7 |- | 25 || 8 || 6 |- | 26 || 8 || 6 |- | 27 || 7 || 5 |- | 28 || 6 || 5 |- | 29 || 6 || 4 |- | 30 || 5 || 4 |} === Level gain and starting energy === When you gain a level, both your current and maximum energy are increased based on various factors:{{refsrc|exper.c|195}} * your [[role]] * your [[race]] * your [[Wisdom]] * your [[experience level]] First, a random number 0 \leq n < \left( \frac{\text{Wisdom}}{2} + \text{role modifier}\right) is chosen;{{refsrc|exper.c|196|comment=The function also considers a race modifier, but this is 0 for all races.}} your race minimum is then added to the result.{{refsrc|exper.c|197|comment=This also considers a role minimum, but this is 0 for all roles.}} Your role modifier depends on whether your experience level (before the level gain) is lower than a certain cutoff which varies between roles. If it is, apply the "low-[[XL]]" modifier; else use the "high-XL" modifier. The result of this is then multiplied with your energy modifier, which depends on your role, and rounded down.{{refsrc|exper.c|201}} The final result will be added to both your current and maximum energy. For a newly created character neither energy modifier nor Wisdom matters{{reffunc|exper.c|newpw}}: certain magically inclined roles start with a few energy points at random, while others only get one point; all races except Dwarves also get a bonus point or two. See the table below for precise numbers. {| class="prettytable striped" ! Role ! Cutoff ! low-[[XL]]
modifier ! high-XL
modifier ! energy modifier{{reffunc|exper.c|enermod}} ! starting |- | [[Archeologist|Arc]] || 14 || 1 || 1 || 1 || 1 |- | [[Barbarian|Bar]] || 10 || 1 || 1 || 3/4 || 1 |- | [[Caveman|Cav]] || 10 || 1 || 1 || 1 || 1 |- | [[Healer|Hea]] || 20 || 1 || 2 || 3/2 || 2-5 |- | [[Knight|Kni]] || 10 || 1 || 2 || 3/2 || 2-5 |- | [[Monk|Mon]] || 10 || 2 || 2 || 1 || 3-4 |- | [[Priest|Pri]] || 10 || 2 || 2 || 2 || 5-7 |- | [[Rogue|Rog]] || 11 || 1 || 1 || 1 || 1 |- | [[Ranger|Ran]] || 12 || 1 || 1 || 1 || 1 |- | [[Samurai|Sam]] || 11 || 1 || 1 || 1 || 1 |- | [[Tourist|Tou]] || 14 || 1 || 1 || 1 || 1 |- | [[Valkyrie|Val]] || 10 || 1 || 1 || 3/4 || 1 |- | [[Wizard|Wiz]] || 12 || 2 || 3 || 2 || 5-7 |} {| class="prettytable" ! Race ! minimum gain ! starting |- | [[Human (starting race)|Human]] || 2 || +1 |- | [[Elf (starting race)|Elf]] || 3 || +2 |- | [[Dwarf (starting race)|Dwarf]] || 0 || no bonus |- | [[Gnome (starting race)|Gnome]] || 2 || +2 |- | [[Orc (starting race)|Orc]] || 1 || +1 |} == Variants == ===SLASH'EM=== Self-teleport costs 30 points of power.{{sourcecode|SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/teleport.c|790}} The energy regeration frequency formula is changed to \lfloor (45 - \mathit{level}) \times 3 / 6 \rfloor turns if you are a [[Wizard]], and every \lfloor (45 - \mathit{level}) \times 4 / 6 \rfloor for all other roles. === FIQHack === There are numerous changes to energy and energy regeneration in [[FIQHack]]. * Monsters and players use the same spellcasting system, which means that monsters use energy to cast spells instead of using a cooldown system. This means they can potentially cast multiple spells in succession if they have enough energy, so high-level spellcasting monsters can do much more damage. * Wisdom is slightly less important for energy regeneration and experience level is slightly more important. Intelligence is not considered. * Wizards get a boost of +0.33pw/turn for energy regeneration * [[The Eye of the Aethiopica]] confers +1pw/turn for energy regeneration * Players can be [[cancelled]], which results in 0 available energy until cured. == References == == External links == * [http://www.steelypips.org/nethack/343/hppw-343.txt HP and power starting values, level increases, and regeneration in NetHack 3.4.3] [[Category:Spellcasting]] [[Category:Your character]] {{nethack-343}}
